Member Function Documentation

bool GrPolygonUberMapping::AddPatch ( GrPolygonUberPatch *  patch  ) 

adds an ubertexture to the current patch.

public methods

make sure the patch passed in is valid! If it's too big or too small, then the patch cannot be packed into an ubertexture.

calculate the size of the patch in patch-tiles (a patch tile is the size of GR_UBERTEX_PATCH_BOUNDARY).

determine if there is enough room for the patch in the current row.

advance to the next line.

determine if there is enough room for the patch in the current ubertexture.

pack the patch at the current location.

advance beyond the current patch and record the maximum height.

add the patch to our vector of patches.

return true to indicate that the patch was successfully added to the ubertexture.

URef< GrUberTexture > GrPolygonUberMapping::BuildUberTexture ( const UPath &  name  )  const

builds an ubertexture out of the currently added geometry.

initialize the rasterizer debugging image.

allocate a bitmask (one bit per tile) and clear it.

generate the morton table that's used to address individual ubertexture tiles.

iterate through all of the faces and generate a tile usage bitmask.

get the current patch.

iterate through each polygon in the current patch.

get the current polygon.

triangulate the current polygon.

iterate through each triangle in the polygon.

rasterize the current triangle.

free the temp verts that we've allocated.

save the rasterizer debugging image.

build a new ubertexture.

free the tile usage bitmask.

return it.
